column4: Hey, I'm in Germany running breezy (which I normally run in the states) and I have trouble logging into public wifi networks. I can pull IP addresses but not get out to even see the welcome page. this happened on T-Mobile and WLAM:802 (another commercial service) is this a known issue?
And the answer seems to be, "In Germany it don't work"
Seriously, I can pull an IP address but I cannot get a browser to pull the start page, nor can I ping things like yahoo.com
I use this same machine in several countries but this is the first time in germany - and the first time I have had problems/
you've got a working DNS server ?
- can't see it. I ran ifconfig and see my ip, broadcast and mask
I sign on with DHCP so I assume they take care of it?
right, it's only specifying search local  at 127.0.0.1
But that's now, on this wired connection, kemik
well you should have some nameserver entries aswell. (and not 127.0.0.1 in search..)
and Marcin, righto. Thanks. Any suggestions about ba name server I can specify in resolv.conf which I can use here in Germany>
i can lend you mine, not sure it'll work tho
